Prop.Name: Function app
Prop.Description: Name of the Function app in Azure.

Prop.Name: Resource group
Prop.Description: Name of the resource group where the function app is defined in Azure.

Group.Name: Identity Configuration
Group.Description: An Azure service principal is an identity created for use with applications, hosted services, and automated tools to access Azure resources.

Prop.Name: Service Principal Application Id
Prop.Description: Application (client) ID of the Service Principal.

Prop.Name: Service Principal Tenant Id
Prop.Description: Directory (tenant) ID of the Service Principal.

Prop.Name: Function name
Prop.Description: Name of the function to be defined on the cloud.

Prop.Name: Trigger Type
Prop.Description: Trigger type of the function. Values: Timer-> A timer trigger lets you run a function on a schedule. Http-> The HTTP trigger lets you invoke a function with an HTTP request. You can use an HTTP trigger to build serverless APIs and respond to webhooks. Blob storage->Integrating with Blob storage allows you to build functions that react to changes in blob data as well as read and write values. Queue->Run as new Azure Queue storage messages are created and write queue messages within the function.

Prop.Name: Blob Storage connection
Prop.Description: The name of an app setting that contains the Storage connection string to use for this binding. If you leave connection empty, the Functions runtime uses the default Storage connection string in the app setting that is named AzureWebJobsStorage. The connection string must be for a general-purpose storage account, not a Blob storage account.

Prop.Name: Queue name
Prop.Description: The name of the queue to poll.

Prop.Name: Queue connection
Prop.Description: The name of an app setting that defines the connection (and its value). Eg:, QueueStorage = <URL> or QueueStorage
